main event: An unidentified object was sighted by a USAF crew over Sidi Slimane Air Base in French Morocco on September 22, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright white light, larger than an ordinary aircraft, that flashed on and off several times over the course of one minute before disappearing.
The object was initially observed at an estimated altitude of 5,000 feet above the ground.
The aircraft conducted a descending circle to try and maintain visual contact with the object, which decreased in speed and eventually disappeared.
A second similar object was also briefly sighted by the crew during their maneuvers.
The report indicates the object's behavior was consistent with it being a weather balloon or similar meteorological device, with no evidence of unusual or unidentified aerial activity.
result: likely a weather balloon or similar meteorological device
sighted object: a bright white light, larger than an ordinary aircraft
location: Sidi Slimane Air Base, French Morocco
